meanings.definition: The internal framework of bones in the body of a vertebrate.
meanings.sent1: Doctors study the skeletons to learn about the human body.
meanings.sent2: The museum displayed dinosaur skeletons for visitors to see.
meanings.sent3: During Halloween, the spooky decorations included fake skeletons hanging on the walls.
meanings.sent4: The old building's crumbling walls revealed the skeletons of its past.
meanings.sent5: In the science class, students assembled paper skeletons to understand anatomy.

meanings.definition: A very basic or essential structure or framework.
meanings.sent1: The skeletons of a story are its plot and characters.
meanings.sent2: The skeletons of a house are its walls and roof.
meanings.sent3: The team worked on the skeletons of their project before adding details.
meanings.sent4: The skeletons of a good speech are clear points and engaging delivery.
meanings.sent5: Understanding the skeletons of a language helps in learning it effectively.
